Body:
Description: Hi,

The console port and client ports communicate on port 443. 

Is there any chance for me to separate them? For example, I want to use 443 when accessing the console, but I want to use a different port when the clients communicate with the server.

Can you tell me how to do it?

Best regards
What We've Learned Updated: Client wants to change the EPP and console port from 443 to a custom one and wants to know if it's possible to do it.
Next Steps Updated: Will have to investigate as I've read in the backend procedures there procedure 35 but need a confirmation.
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Invitation updated. Attendees: Marian Ilies, Adrian Draghici
Invitation updated. Attendees: Marian Ilies, Adrian Draghici, Yunus ICIN
Invitation updated. Attendees: Marian Ilies, Daniel Anton, Yunus ICIN
Invitation updated. Attendees: Marian Ilies, Daniel Anton
Invitation updated. Attendees: Marian Ilies, Yunus ICIN

What We've Learned Updated: Connected remote along with Daniel to change the IP port.
We encountered a problem with the tests initially but after going to the sysctl.conf from /etc/sysctl.conf we added net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind = 1 and tested again.

Client was successfully able to connect
